p.s: In his speech at the opening ceremonies of COP26 in Glasgow, as a people's advocate, Sir David Frederick Attenborough tries to convince and urge his audience to act on climate change, by illustrating now it affects humankind nowadays.
Therefore he uses stylistic devices and communicative strategies.

In his introduction he starts off by defining what needneeds to be achieved at the end of COP26, which is to come to a conclusion by what percentage the carbon concentration on earth has to be lowered, and how to achieve that.
Furthermore explains how a stable climate enabled the civilization and evolution of the Homo sapiens in the past ten centuries.
And how the current climate crisis in dangers are stabilised modern world.
In his next paragraph he touches upon the topic of younger people living today, having to witness nature decaying under the humanshumans' hand, without being at fault for the start of climate change.
Attenborough acknowledges and declares that the older generation is responsible for this outcome, should be the ones to act now.
By pursuing unity and working as a team he states that he can imagine to achieve certain goals towards slowing down, and ending climate change.
In his conclusion he mentions the aspect of young peoplespeople's expectations and reassuring his audience the change is possible.
